title: Understanding Controls
text: Controls are elements that allow users to interact with a worksheet. They can be buttons, checkboxes, or other interactive elements.

title: Types of Controls
text: There are two main types of controls used in Excel to create user interfaces. One type is simpler and more commonly used, while the other offers more advanced features.

title: Form Controls
text: Form controls are simpler and easier to use. They are ideal for basic tasks and are compatible with earlier versions of Excel.

title: ActiveX Controls
text: ActiveX controls offer more advanced features and flexibility. They are suitable for more complex tasks but may not be compatible with all versions of Excel.

title: Identify the Controls
text: What are the two types of controls used to create the user interface?
